author: HuAaron
body:
The powershell output encountered two issues on centos 7 when running in screen session:
Prerequest:
install screen and run powershell in screen session.

Version:
$PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.2
OS                             Linux 4.19.48-001.ali4000.alios7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Sep 30 15:50:11 CST 2019
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

screen --version
Screen version 4.01.00devel (GNU) 2-May-06
uname -r
4.19.48.x86_64

Issues:
1. when open pwsh-preview and type command like "virsh list", the console just hangs.
2. when run pwsh-preview **.ps1 and some of the output was vanished( some of the output were displayed but some were not).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Please share PSTableVersion as issue template requests.
Can your repo with latest PowerShell 7.0 RC2 build? Without PSReadline?

comments.author: HuAaron
comments.body:
> Please share PSTableVersion as issue template requests.

Yes. The psversion is rc2. What do you mean about "Without PSReadline”

comments.body:
> @HuAaron unload PSReadline module
> 
> ```powershell

Still the same.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
What is TERM is on your system?
See https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2364

comments.author: HuAaron
comments.body:
> What is TERM is on your system?
> See #2364

MobaXterm. This issue can also reproduce when using Windows Terminal Preview ssh remotely. 
Issue 2364 was about running screen in ps. But this issue was about running ps in screen. :)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @HuAaron You could play with TERM. Also you could do `remove-module PSReadline` and share results.

comments.author: HuAaron
comments.body:
> @HuAaron You could play with TERM. Also you could do `remove-module PSReadline` and share results.
remove-module PSReadline -- still the same.
I use tmux instead of screen and all issues are gone.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: So the issue is related MobaXterm?

comments.author: HuAaron
comments.body:
> So the issue is related MobaXterm?

No. It is related to screen. Works fine for tmux.
